title: Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development: California Competes Grant Program.
subject: CaliforniaCompetesGrantProgram
Governor'sOfficeofBusinessandEconomicDevelopment

abstracts.abstract:
Existing law establishes the Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development, also known as "GO-Biz," to, among other duties, serve the Governor as the lead entity for economic strategy and the marketing of California on issues relating to business development, private sector investment, and economic growth.

Existing law, until January 1, 2030, and upon appropriation by the Legislature, creates the California Competes Grant Program, which, among other things, authorizes the Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development to provide grants to an applicant that meets specified criteria relating to the creation of jobs or investments in the state.

This bill would extend the operation of these provisions until January 1, 2031.

other_titles.title: Governor's Office of Business and Economic Development.

actions.description: From printer. May be heard in committee March 24.
Referred to Com. on E.D., G., & H.I.
From committee chair, with author's amendments: Amend, and re-refer to Com. on E.D., G., & H.I. Read second time and amended.
Re-referred to Com. on E.D., G., & H.I.
From committee: Do pass and re-refer to Com. on APPR. with recommendation: To Consent Calendar. (Ayes 8. Noes 0.) (April 22). Re-referred to Com. on APPR.
Died pursuant to Art. IV, Sec. 10(c) of the Constitution.
From committee: Filed with the Chief Clerk pursuant to Joint Rule 56.
